tool.name: NRT_Create_Monitoring_Areas

param.name: in_feat
param.dialogReference: Set the input monitoring area feature class as derived early via the "NRT Create Project" tool. Any feature class not created by the aforementioned tool will be rejected.

param.name: in_new_feat
param.dialogReference: Select an existing polygon from another shapefile via the drop down control, or click the pencil icon to begin drawing a new polygon on the fly. It is recommended that your monitoring areas are at least 30 square metres in area size to ensure at least one pixel is captured. Note: only one polygon will be accepted per run of this tool, so please create each monitoring area one at a time.

param.name: in_area_id
param.dialogReference: Set a unique monitoring area identifier or code. For example: A01, MonArea02, etc. Avoid using special characters and spaces. Duplicate values will be rejected.

param.name: in_platform
param.dialogReference: Select between whether Landsat or Sentinel data is to be used for a monitoring area. Landsat provides 35+ years of archived data at 30 m resolution, whereas Sentinel provides 10 m resolution imagery from 2015 onwards.

param.name: in_s_year
param.dialogReference: Set the starting year of the "pre-impact" period. The harmonic regression model will be trained entirely on this period. As an example, if vegetation was in good, stable condition for two or more years, you might want to start somewhere at the beginning of the stable period. This period can be changed later on using the "NRT Modify Monitoring Areas" tool if the initial period is poorly selected. Note: A period of two or more years (between start and end period) is recommended.

param.name: in_e_year
param.dialogReference: Set the ending year of the "pre-impact" period. The harmonic regression model will be trained entirely on this period. As an example, if vegetation was in good, stable condition for two or more years, you might want to end somewhere at the end of the stable period. This period can be changed later on using the "NRT Modify Monitoring Areas" tool if the initial period is poorly selected. Note: A period of two or more years (between start and end period) is recommended.

param.name: in_veg_idx
param.dialogReference:
Set the vegetation index used to derive vegetation "greeness". Options include:

  • NDVI

  • MAVI

  • kNDVI

param.name: in_persistence
param.dialogReference: Persistence is best considered as the minimum number of observations needed to consider a change. In other words, a lower persistence will register a deviation sooner than a higher persistence, but is prone to more noise. A value between 0.2 and 0.5 has been found to work best, but experimentation is required.

param.name: in_min_conseqs
param.dialogReference: This is a parameter specific to rule 1, which counts the number of consecutive increases or decreases to vegetation deviation. An alarm will only be triggered once a certain number of consecutive increases or decreases has been reached, as set here. For example, if a value of 2 is set here, an alarm will not be signaled until that decline has occurred two times in a row. A higher value here will mean an alarm is only triggered when considerable trend has been observed, whereas a lower value will trigger alarms for minor trending deviations.

param.name: in_inc_plateaus
param.dialogReference: By default, the rule 1 trigger system does not include plateau periods (e.g., a period of several samples that were the exact same deviation value neither up or down). Set this to Yes to include plateaus in the consecutive alarm trigger calculation.

param.name: in_min_stdv
param.dialogReference: Rule 2 can be used to threshold out (or ignore) specific ranges of deviations. For example, to ignore statistically less significant deviations in the range 0 to 1, set the minimum standard deviation required rule here to 1. To incude all changes regardless, set this to 0.

param.name: in_bidirectional
param.dialogReference: If bi-directional is set to Yes, then rule 2 will be calculated for both positive and negative deviation values (i.e. a minimum std. dev. value of 1 set above will be a range -1 to 1 as excluded. If No is set here, only the value range 0 to 1 will be excluded, meaning 0 to -1 could cause a trigger alarm.

param.name: in_num_zones
param.dialogReference: Rule 3 is used to detect sharp "spikes" in value jumps, if detected. The value here determines how many zones must be jumped before a trigger is sent. The smaller the value here, the smaller the spike will be. Set this value higher for significant spikes in vegetation values.

param.name: in_ruleset
param.expression: {1 and 2 or 3 | 1 Only | 2 Only | 3 Only | 1 and 2 | 1 and 3 | 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 | 1 or 3 | 2 or 3 | 1 and 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 or 3}
param.dialogReference:
The ruleset sets the unique combinations of rules to be used for trigger alarms. The available rules include:

  • 1 Only: only rule 1 is considered

  • 2 Only: only rule 2 is considered

  • 3 Only: only rule 3 is considered

  • 1 and 2 : rule 1 and 2 are combined and considered

  • 1 and 3: rule 1 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 2 and 3: rule 2 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 1 or 2 : rule 1 or 2 are considered

  • 1 or 3 : rule 1 or 3 are considered

  • 2 or 3 : rule 2 or 3 are considered

  • 1 and 2 and 3: rules 1, 2 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 1 or 2 and 3: rules 1 or (2 and 3) are considered

  • 1 and 2 or 3: rules (1 and 2) or 3 are considered

  • 1 or 2 or 3: rules 1 or 2 or 3 are considered

The default is 1 and 2 or 3.

param.name: in_alert_user
param.dialogReference: If set to Yes, the user will obtain an email alert if an email address is provided below. Otherwise, no email will be sent.

param.name: in_alert_direction
param.dialogReference: Users can decided whether an email address is sent only when trend is positive (incline), negative (decline) or any direction (both).

param.name: in_email
param.dialogReference: Set the email address of the person who will receive trigger alerts for this monitoring area.

param.name: in_ignore_user
param.dialogReference: If set to Yes, this monitoring area will be ignored during monitoring. Useful if the monitoring area is no longer being monitored.

tool.summary: Once a near real-time project folder has been set up, use this tool to begin creating unique monitoring area polygons anywhere in Australia. A valid monitoring areas feature class created from the NRT Create Project tool is required as input. Then, users can click on the pencil icon to draw a new monitoring area (one per tool run). Consideration should be made to set a pre-impact range of years to train the model. Various rules can be considered, and email alerts can be set on a per-monitoring area basis/
